subsection.name: Installation
subsection.p: To install Eoulsan, go to the Eoulsan installation page and follow the detail procedure.

subsection.name: Create parameter file
subsection.p: To create a parameter file, the best solution is to reuse an existing parameter file (see sample section) and adapt it to your needs.

The parameter file contains the list of the step that will be executed by Eoulsan. By careful some step are only available in local mode (like differential analysis) or in distributed mode, see the steps page for more details. For each step you can change, add or remove parameters. Parameters are specific to a step, consult the documentation of the built-in steps for the list of available parameters of each step.
At least, there is a global section in the parameter file that override the values of Eoulsan configuration file. This section is useful to set for example the path of the temporary directory to use.

Once started and before starting analysis, Eoulsan will check if:

ul.li: The design file and parameter file are valid
The parameter of all the steps are valid
The order of the step is correct (a step can not use data generated after its end)
The input files are valid (fasta and annotation files)
A genome mapper index is needed. In this case, a step to generated this index is added

subsection.p: If successful, you wil obtain a new directory name like eoulsan-20110310-101235 with log files about the analysis. Results files are stored in the current directory of the user.

subsection.name: Launch Eoulsan on Amazon Web Service Cloud
subsection.p: You must have an AWS account for Amazon S3 and Amazon MapReduce to launch Eoulsan on Amazon cloud. Then you must set Amazon credentials in Eoulsan configuration or in the parameter file (see hadoop configuration). You can launch Eoulsan analysis with the following command:
In AWS mode, there is 2 phases in the analysis:

ul.li: First data to analyse, design and parameter files are upload to your S3 bucket on Amazon Cloud.

Then, the cluster in the cloud is created and the "real" analysis starts. Eoulsan on your local computer only wait the end of the analysis. You can quit Eoulsan or shutdown your computer, no data will be lost and analysis will continue on the cloud.

subsection.p: At the end of the analysis, the results files and logs will be in a new directory in your S3 bucket named like eoulsan-20110310-101235 (the numbers in the directory name after eoulsan are respectively the date and the time of the launch of the analysis). You must manualy download this data from S3 to your computer
